column2: My liege, the Order of the Flaming Rose stand ready to serve you in defense of Eternal Fire! Pax Christi,\n\nGrand Master [From.GetFirstName]
My [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName], has requested to join the Order of the Flaming Rose in their struggle against monsters and other evils, even though this will forever disinherit him.
Go with my blessing
Absolutely not!
[This.GetTitledFirstName] becomes a member of the Order of the Flaming Rose.
[This.GetTitledFirstName] is disappointed.

Most righteous [Root.GetTitledFirstName], the Order needs more castles in order to train troops and generate a supporting income. It has come to my attention that there is a suitable location in your demesne - in [FromFrom.GetName] to be specific. I am willing to pay you 100 gold in exchange for the right to construct a fortress there.
Pax Christi,

Grand Master [From.GetFirstName]
A reasonable request
Absolutely not!
The Order of the Flaming Rose have constructed a castle in [Root.GetName]!
Impressive!

Your Highness, this extremely generous donation will not be forgotten. You have my friendship, as well as that of the Church. Rest assured that you will be rewarded in Heaven, if not on Earth!
Pax Christi,

Grand Master [From.GetFirstName]

Your majesty, this antagonism is completely unwarranted! The Order serves Eternal Fire, but, one has to wonder, do you?

With anger and sadness,

Grand Master [From.GetFirstName]
Good Riddance!
Vassalize the Order of the Flaming Rose
As the King of Jerusalem, it is within my power to vassalize the powerful Order of the Flaming Rose at the cost of 500 gold.
Expel the Order of the Flaming Rose
I can drive the Order of the Flaming Rose from my realm and seize their castles. However, it is a very impious thing to do...
Donate 300¤ to the Order of the Flaming Rose
I can donate money to the Order of the Flaming Rose in exchange for Piety and lifelong respect from the priesthood.
